Title: An analogue of the Washington-sinnott theorem for elliptic curves with complex multiplication I
Abstract: © 2015 London Mathematical Society.In this paper, we generalize Washington's theorem on the stabilization of the p-part of the ideal class groups in the cyclotomic ℤ<inf>q</inf>-extension of an abelian number field for distinct primes p and q. We fix an imaginary quadratic field K and a split prime q of K lying above q and let K<inf>∞</inf>/K denote the ℤ<inf>q</inf>-extension which is unramified outside q. We show that if F/K is a finite abelian extension, and if F<inf>∞</inf> = FK<inf>∞</inf>, then, for a prime p satisfying certain conditions, the p-part of the class groups stabilize in the ℤ<inf>p</inf>-extension F<inf>∞</inf>/F. We also show that if E/K is an elliptic curve with complex multiplication by the ring of integers of K, then under the same conditions on a prime p, the p-part of the Selmer groups for E/F<inf>n</inf> stabilize as F<inf>n</inf> runs over the finite layers of F<inf>∞</inf>F.
